name: Framework and Runtime (Astro + GitHub Pages)

inScope: Static-site build pipeline for GitHub Pages
Layouts, routing, and shared components for home, case studies index/detail, and contact
Dark off-black base theme wired into Tailwind design tokens
outOfScope: Decap CMS content modelling and admin configuration

commitments.description: Initialize an Astro project with TypeScript and a project structure aligned with the tech spec.
Implement a shared layout with icon-based primary navigation and a footer region for company logos and social links.

Configure Tailwind CSS with custom design tokens (colors, typography, spacing) supporting a dark off-black theme with off-white (slightly muted) icons and UI elements, subtle gradients, and animations respecting prefers-reduced-motion.
Configure a GitHub Actions workflow to build the Astro site and deploy to GitHub Pages.

deliverables.description: Astro project in the repository with TypeScript configured, base layout, routing, and shared components.
GitHub Actions workflow files to install dependencies, run Astro build, and publish the static site to GitHub Pages.

localDev: Install + dev command runs the Astro dev server without errors.
Home, case studies, and contact routes all render (placeholder content allowed).
buildAndDeploy: Build command completes successfully on a clean checkout.
GitHub Actions pipeline builds and publishes to GitHub Pages, resulting in a working production site at the configured URL.
visual: Global styles use a dark off-black background with accessible contrast.
Navigation icons and UI elements use off-white (slightly muted, not pure white) color.
Subtle gradients and animations implemented via tokens/utilities respect prefers-reduced-motion.

dependenciesAndRisks: GitHub repository and GitHub Pages correctly configured for the target domain.
Astro tooling and GitHub Actions runners compatible with the selected Node.js version.
Design token changes may impact existing components and should be introduced carefully.
